Side Effects: Apathy_ high triglyceride levels_ vivid dreams_ prolonged nighttime erection.
Comments: I started taking this after suffering a psychosis caused by an antibiotic (clarithromycin). Remeron is the only medicine that allowed me to regain an almost natural sleep. It put a stop to the paranoia_ the auditory hallucinations and the general anxiety. In retrospect it probably saved my life. I started with 15 MG at bedtime. The side effects will hit you first (deep sleep_ vivid dreams_ general apathy) but most of them go away after a couple of months. The general apathy is the most annoying side effect but I'd rather have that than the confused restless state I was in prior to taking Remeron. I'm not out of the wood yet but at least I see a light at the end of the tunnel. Another side effect is that my triglyceride levels have trebled so I have to take another drug to control that (I take something called Artechol_ which is some kind of natural statin_ it works pretty well without side effects).

Side Effects: No reduction in depression or anxiety

I was never disappointed in the drug until I stopped taking it.  It has some severe withdrawal symptoms.  I stopped taking it because my GP more or less told me to; some recent blood tests indicated my liver was under strain and he thinks remeron is the likely culprit.  I do not drink or take other drugs_ so I think he is likely right.  Anyhow_ since I stopped taking it_ I only sleep one REM cycle and then wake up wired at 3-4 in the morning.  It's making for some pretty weird days.  I also have a constant headache.  The withdrawal symptons only strengthen my resolve to stop taking it.  I don't think I am actually depressed or in danger of reverting to some unstable state.  I was teenager that was getting into trouble when I started taking it.  I was an unstable teenage_ but 15 years later I'm a pretty stable person_ I don't think I need this medication and am sorry I took it for so long_ but quitting it is going to be much harder than I thought.  People need their sleep.

Not 100% sure how long i was taking it_ meds have ruined my memory a bit.  Vivid/erradic/relistic dreams_ stopped taking it a year or so ago (i think) and still have the problem. Makes waking up incredibly hard_ as if it's hard to adjust to this reality after spending so much time in another_ wake up with unclear mind_ no concentration etc
Comments: I can't make a judgment if you should take it_ but i will say i deeply regret ever having touched this medicine_ ruined my life ever since taking it

Side Effects: Lack of mental clarity & major weight gain.
i knock out in the night and wake up fresh in the morning

Comments: i was addicted to benzodiazepines but my doc tried Remeron to ease the withdrawl. it helped

Remeron is the closest thing to a wonder drug that we have. I have tried just about everything out there. I have fired 2 pdocs. A kind GP finally prescribed Remeron. I will never quit taking Remeron ever.

Side Effects: sleepiness at first_ which lessened then some weight gain later
Comments: I gained more weight on Paxil than Remeron.

Side Effects: not just restless legs -I called it "restless body" Cannot take the medicine at bedtime as directed. Although I do feel very sleepy after taking it_ I cannot rest because of the irresitble muscle urges in my abdomninal muscles and legs. Makes me quite sleepy for about 1 hour after taking. Increased appetite- have gained about 10 pounds in 3 months.
Comments: I was prescribed this drug after a period of suicidal ideation (probably from high dose of Neurontin_ which I started taking for pain.) It took a while for remeron to kick in with me but I feel almost back to my normal self. i still do experience pain_ but it is not as intense and I don't "care about it" or obsess on it the way I did before. So remeron has helped me cut back on my pain medication significantly. I also do not need any sleeping aide or tranquilizer any more. I am very satisfied with Remeron. I take one in the morning (which my doc thinks is weird) and one while I'm fixing dinner. cannot take at bedtime due to the AWFUL restless "everything" it gives me.
